intro: Fritillaria wanjiangensis, commonly known as the Wanjiang fritillary, is a rare bulbous plant native to China. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its bulbs are adapted to survive in cold climates, and it blooms during the spring season. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
